thread.title: Stingrays fall to Atlanta, 4-0, to conclude preseason
thread.title_full: Stingrays fall to Atlanta, 4-0, to conclude preseason

title: Stingrays fall to Atlanta, 4-0, to conclude preseason
text: Stingrays fall to Atlanta, 4-0, to conclude preseason Staff reports Oct 11 2015 1:39 am × The South Carolina Stingrays concluded preseason play Saturday night with a 4-0 loss to the Atlanta Gladiators at the Carolina Ice Palace. The Stingrays finished the preseason 0-2-0 heading into opening night Oct. 17 against the Reading Royals at the North Charleston Coliseum. Leading 1-0 on a Tyler Shiplo power play goal, the Gladiators scored three times in the second period to take a commanding lead. Brock Higgs doubled Atlanta’s lead only 2:30 into the middle frame. The forward split the South Carolina defense and slid the puck five-hole on Stingrays goaltender Vitek Vanecek. J.T. Barrett tallied the lone assist on the play. Soccer Sidney Doherty scored the game-winner in the 86th minute as Charleston Southern defeated Francis Marion, 2-1. Anna Sells tied the match in the 76th minute as the junior forward connected on her sixth goal of the season off the pass from Chelsea Frankeny. Sells added an assist on Doherty’s game-winner in the 86th minute for her second assist of the year as CSU improved to 4-5-2 in the 2015 season. Liz Amanda Brown recorded three saves on the afternoon in posting the win inside the net for the Buccaneers. Taylor O’Berry had 15 saves in the loss for the Patriots. After fighting hard for 110 minutes, the College of Charleston men could not find the back of the net in a 0-0 draw with James Madison at Patriots Point. Both of the Cougars’ shots came from forward Kye West. The Cougars (5-4-2, 2-1-1 CAA) tallied seven shots in the second half alone with four coming on goal but could not capitalize. Volleyball Addison Kaderli led the Buccaneers with 15 kills as Charleston Southern topped visiting S.C. State in the Buc Dome in four sets, 23-25, 25-22, 25-21, 25-17. The Bucs fell in the first set, but rallied over the final three frames to capture the win. Krista Kuglin added 11 kills to the CSU (5-15) offense, while Katrina Houston had 10 kills over the final three frames as the Buccaneers combined to hit .154 from the floor as a team. The College of Charleston swept William and Mary 3-0 (25-21, 29-27, 25-19) at Kaplan Arena. Freshman Allison Beckman recorded 44 assists. Trailing 10-9 in the opening set, Kayla Tronick blocked a Tribe (7-12, 1-5) attack, spurring a 10-3 C of C (11-8, 3-2) run. Allison Beckman secured the Cougars’ 25-21 win with an ace, and earned another in the second set to give her 19 on the season, a team high and fifth-best mark in the CAA. Freshman Kennedy Madison was hot early as she notched five kills in the set. Coming of her recording-breaking performance on Thursday, where she set a school record with a .833 hitting percentage, Rachel was again solid for the Cougars. For the match she recorded a game-high 20 kills and also turned in 11 digs for her fourth double-double of the season. It was a back-and-forth affair late, but a pair of kill from Melissa Morello and another from Rachel put the set away. Seven more kills from Rachel helped secure the third set and handing the Cougars their third consecutive victory. Morello finished with 19 kills and 10 digs. Britney Vallez paced CofC with 19 digs.
